title: RGB and RGBA Values
description: Learn about RGB format for representing colors

intro.title: Introduction
intro.content: RGB format uses three values from 0 to 255 for red, green, and blue channels. RGBA adds an alpha channel for transparency.

rgb.title: RGB
rgb.content: RGB uses three values from 0 to 255. For example, rgb(255, 0, 0) represents pure red color.

rgba.title: RGBA
rgba.content: RGBA adds a fourth value from 0 to 1 for transparency. For example, rgba(0, 168, 204, 0.5) represents semi-transparent cyan.

usage.title: Usage
usage.content: RGB format is intuitive and often used in graphics editors. RGBA is useful for creating semi-transparent elements.
